title: International Tax General Associate - Winter 2025
description:
We are the leading provider of professional services to the middle market globally, our purpose is to instill confidence in a world of change, empowering our clients and people to realize their full potential. Our exceptional people are the key to our unrivaled, inclusive culture and talent experience and our ability to be compelling to our clients. You’ll find an environment that inspires and empowers you to thrive both personally and professionally. There’s no one like you and that’s why there’s nowhere like RSM.


**Position Description**

At RSM, we work with large and small companies in various industries. They develop strong working relationships with clients built on understanding their businesses and challenges. We work on multiple team engagements each year, including several pieces of any particular assignment - not just one part. Working in a mutually respectful team environment helps our associates perform at their best and integrate their career with their personal life.  



**Examples of the candidate’s responsibilities include** **:**

* Providing clients with strategic, integrated tax solutions focused on outbound and inbound structuring
* Demonstrating a general knowledge of foreign tax credits
* Completing tax planning and research
* Developing an understanding of worldwide tax minimization, transfer pricing, and accounting for income taxes
* Assisting with IFRS/GAAP convergence and foreign assignment planning
* Working with businesses around the world to build successful cross-border tax strategies
**Basic** **Q** **ualifications:**

* Minimum B.A., B.S. , or J.D. degree or equivalent from an accredited university
* Accounting major
* Travel to assigned client locations is required. Must have access to and ability to arrange for use of reliable modes of transportation to those locations
* Minimum 3.0 GPA preferred
**Preferred** **Q** **ualifications** **:**

* Working toward the successful completion of the CPA exam - tax associates have the opportunity to obtain the audit hours required for full certification
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Excel
* Ability to work effectively on a team
* Ability to work and multitask in a fast-paced environment
At RSM, we offer a competitive benefits and compensation package for all our people. We offer flexibility in your schedule, empowering you to balance life’s demands, while also maintaining your ability to serve clients. Learn more about our total rewards at https://rsmus.com/careers/working-at-rsm/benefits .


As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, all applicants will receive consideration for employment as RSM does not tolerate discrimination and/or harassment based on race; color; creed; sincerely held religious beliefs, practices or observances; sex (including pregnancy or disabilities related to nursing); gender (including gender identity and/or gender expression); sexual orientation; HIV Status; national origin; ancestry; familial or marital status; age; physical or mental disability; citizenship; political affiliation; medical condition (including family and medical leave); domestic violence victim status; past, current or prospective service in the US uniformed service; pre-disposing genetic characteristics or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law.


Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process and/or employment/partnership. RSM is committed to providing equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application, interview, or otherwise participate in the recruiting process, please call us at 800-274-3978 or send us an email at careers@rsmus.com .


RSM does not intend to hire entry level candidates who will require sponsorship now OR in the future (i.e. F-1 visa holders). If you are a recent U.S. college / university graduate possessing 1-2 years of progressive and relevant work experience in a same or similar role to the one for which you are applying, excluding internships, you may be eligible for hire as an experienced associate.


RSM will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in accordance with the requirements of applicable law, including but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


At RSM, an employee’s pay at any point in their career is intended to reflect their experiences, performance, and skills for their current role. The salary range (or starting rate for interns and associates) for this role represents numerous factors considered in the hiring decisions including, but not limited to, education, skills, work experience, certifications, location, etc. As such, pay for the successful candidate(s) could fall anywhere within the stated range.


Compensation Range: $72,160 - $86,100
Individuals selected for this role will be eligible for a discretionary bonus based on firm and individual performance.

title: Supervisor, Tax Controversy
description:
We are the leading provider of professional services to the middle market globally, our purpose is to instill confidence in a world of change, empowering our clients and people to realize their full potential. Our exceptional people are the key to our unrivaled, inclusive culture and talent experience and our ability to be compelling to our clients. You’ll find an environment that inspires and empowers you to thrive both personally and professionally. There’s no one like you and that’s why there’s nowhere like RSM.


**Washington National Tax Supervisor - Tax Controversy Summary:**

You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.


Understanding the impact of existing tax laws is hard enough, and new legislation, judicial decisions and administrative authority compound the challenges. Professionals in RSM's Washington National Tax (WNT) office advise clients and RSM client engagement teams with respect to complex issues across a wide range of tax specialty practice areas. WNT is seeking a professional to join its Tax Controversy/ Practice and Procedure team.


In this role, you will consult with clients and RSM professionals across the firm with respect to a wide range of tax controversy, tax practice and procedure issues.


**Specific responsibilities will include:**

* Research, address, and consult on technical issues specific to IRS practice and procedural issues including tax, penalty and interest assessments, statutes of limitation for refunds and assessments.
* Represent clients before the Internal Revenue Service (“IRS”).
* Prepare written communications to the IRS regarding penalty abatement requests.
* Working on the IRS account issues, corrections and reconciliations.
* Prepare Private Letter Ruling Requests.
* Work with other specialty groups on issues that intersect with other technical matters such as corporate taxation, partnerships, international tax, mergers and acquisitions.
* Participate in firm trainings.
* Manage multiple projects in fast-paced and collaborative environment.
* Mentor staff and provide on the job training and supervision.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* J.D., LL.M, CPA or Enrolled Agent license required
* A bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field of law or business degree with at least 4-5 years of experience in tax
* Experience with BBA Partnership Audit Rules
* R&D Tax Controversy Experience
* Experience working with professional services, professional tax organizations or government
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong research and writing skills
* Ability to work and communicate with internal and external clients
* Ability to explain complex tax issues to non-tax professionals or clients
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously

* Licensed CPA or J.D

3+ years of experience in Tax

Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.

title: Front Office Supervisor
company: Courtyard by Marriott New York Downtown Financial District
description:
**REPORTS TO:** Front Office Manager


**SUPERVISES DIRECTLY:** All front office personnel including guest reception, concierge, reservations, PBX and bell staffs.


**Benefits/Perks of Working With Us:**


Upon joining Real Hospitality Group, associates are offered competitive compensation, career growth opportunities, flexible access to wages, holiday, sick and vacation pay, health, dental and vision insurance, employer paid life, accidental death, and dismemberment insurance, an employee assistance program, a 401k, and many associate discount options.


**Purpose for the Position:** The Front Office supervisor will assume full responsibility for the management of the day-to-day and long-term hotel guest reception, reservations and telephone service operations, while maintaining established revenue, expense and quality standards. To work with the General Manager to ensure an efficient operation that provides levels of service that consistently exceeds visitor, guest and ownership expectations.


**The Front Office Supervisor Essential Responsibilities****:**


* To ensure that guests are greeted, checked in and allocated rooms promptly and courteously.


* To ensure that check-in procedures are strictly adhered to and that the correct address and charge out details are obtained from each guest.


* To be readily available at all times to deal with problems or complaints.


* To ensure that rooms have been serviced and maintained to the standards established by the Company.


* To ensure maximum room occupancy within agreed overbooking policy.


* To ensure effective liaison between reservations and front office staff with other departments (e.g. housekeeping).


* To ensure that all charges are correctly entered on the guest's bill and that this is up to date at all times.


* To ensure that credit control procedures are strictly adhered to, that no bills exceed the stipulated limit without prior approval and that written confirmation, purchase orders, or order numbers are on file.


* To ensure that accounts are balanced daily.


* To ensure effective and speedy check-out procedures.


* To ensure that luggage is delivered to and collected from rooms speedily.


* To ensure that inquiries, messages, theatre bookings are dealt with courteously and efficiently.


* To ensure that all Front of House staff are correctly dressed at all times.


* To ensure that all Front of House areas are clean and orderly at all times.


* To ensure that newspapers and parcels are delivered to rooms without delay.


* To ensure that incoming and outgoing telephone calls are handled promptly and courteously.


* To ensure maximum security of all items left in safety deposit boxes.


* To ensure that the Hotel Entrance is easily accessible to cars and taxis at all times.


* To hold regular performance appraisals with all staff, identifying areas for development and training needs and ensuring that this training is affected.


* To carry out or ensure that regular On-the-Job training is taking place to agreed standards.


* To ensure that the most suitably qualified person is appointed in the event of a vacancy - wherever possible this should be an internal promotion.


* To ensure maximum security in all areas under your control.


* To act as Duty Manager when required.


* To attend Management Meetings as required.


* To ensure accurate and timeliness submission of all reports and administrative work.


* To monitor trends within the industry and make suggestions how these could be implemented.


* To be familiar with all local Civil Defense measures.


* To ensure that staff under your control are trained in Civil Defense measures.


* Takes responsibility of supervising the F&B outlets in the absence of the F&B Supervisor.


**To do this kind of work, you must be able to:**


* Read and interpret business records and statistical reports.
* Use mathematical skills to interpret financial information and prepare budgets.
* Analyze and interpret established policies.
* Understand government regulations covering business operation.
* Make business decisions based on production reports and similar facts as well as on your own experience and personal opinions.
* See differences in widths and lengths of lines such as those on graphs.
* Deal with the general public, customers, associates, union and government officials with tact and courtesy.
* Plan and organize the work of others.
* Change activity frequently and cope with interruptions.
* Speak and write clearly.
* Accept full responsibility for managing an activity.
* Complete all assigned tasks, reports, projects etc. in a professional manner and on an on-time basis.
* Be available for work evenings, weekends and holidays.

**Physical Demands:** Lifting 20 lbs. Maximum with frequent lifting and/or carrying of objects weighing up to 10 lbs. Requires walking or standing to a significant degree, reaching, handling, feeling, talking, hearing.

title: Lifeguard
description:
**Benefits/Perks of Working With Us:**


Upon joining Real Hospitality Group, associates are offered competitive compensation, career growth opportunities, flexible access to wages, holiday, sick and vacation pay, health, dental and vision insurance, employer paid life, accidental death, and dismemberment insurance, an employee assistance program, a 401k, and many associate discount options.


**Purpose for the Position:** The Lifeguard is responsible for monitoring pool activity and facilitating safe and appropriate pool practices, rescuing and assisting those in need, providing instruction to participants and maintaining a clean pool environment.


**The Lifeguard Essential Responsibilities:**


* Caution swimmers regarding unsafe practices and safety hazards, and enforce and adhere to pool rules and regulations.


* Maintain order in the pool and adjoining areas at all times.


* Rescue swimmers in danger of drowning and administer First Aid when necessary.


* Responsible for safe water conditions such as chlorine and pH levels in the pool.


* Inspect facilities for cleanliness, complete general pool cleaning, and maintenance duties.


* Maintain clean environment by picking up used towels, trash, or any other obstacles that might be present.


* Provide general information on pool operation to patrons.


* Follow all direction given by supervisors or management.


**To do this kind of work, you must be able to:**


* Must be alert and attentive at all times while on duty.
* Previous pool lifeguard experience preferred.
* Displays strong decision making ability.
* Must have knowledge of pool equipment and be able to read and determine chlorine content and pH using a water testing kit and keep a log of all readings.
* Must be available for work on evenings, weekends, and holidays.

**Specific Vocational Preparation:**Must have American Red Cross lifeguard certification. Must be certified in adult/child/infant CPR.

title: Bar Back
description:
**REPORTS TO:** Restaurant Manager


**Benefits/Perks of Working With Us:**


Upon joining Real Hospitality Group, associates are offered competitive compensation, career growth opportunities, flexible access to wages, holiday, sick and vacation pay, health, dental and vision insurance, employer paid life, accidental death, and dismemberment insurance, an employee assistance program, a 401k, and many associate discount options.


**Purpose for the Position:** The Bar Back will provide friendly and excellent service to every guest as well as keep the beverage area clean and stocked at all times.


**The Bar Back Essential Responsibilities:**


* Responsible for ensuring a consistent flow of services to guest and cocktail servers by assisting bartender with their job functions.


* Ensure that bar and floors are clean and used glassware is removed from bar tops.


* Clear and wipe down tables in absence of a cocktail server.


* Maintain a clean work environment in accordance with Health Department standards.


* Check glass washers for proper chemical mixture and volume.


* Maintain soap and towels at hand sinks in all bars.


* Maintain par stock levels by placing orders for wine, champagne, beer, liquor, and perishables at start of shift.


* Receive and deliver all products to appropriate outlet and stock in accordance to specification.


* Stock server wells in accordance to specifications with all product and supplies required.


* Cut fruit to specification and prepare all condiment caddies.


* Collect trash from all outlets throughout shift and wipe down walls behind trash containers.


* Distribute clean bar towels, collect soiled ones, and discard them in the appropriate place.


* Collect all excess glasses from bars and restock them in their appropriate outlets in accordance to specification and retrieve bar glassware from dish areas.


* Organize and clean pump rooms, coolers, and storage areas to specification.


* Sweep and mop pump rooms, coolers, and storage area floors.


* Soak and clean soda bag-in-box hoses and nozzles.


* Replace and rotate draught beer kegs, liquor pump rooms, and soda bag-in-boxes as required.


* Continuously monitor bar to ensure that all guests receive beverage service in a timely manner.


* Attend and satisfactorily complete all training as assigned and required.


**To do this kind of work, you must be able to:**


* Previous busser experience preferred, but not required.
* Good communication and hospitality skills.
* Carry out specific oral or written instructions, frequently following a simple routine.
* Do the same task over and over, frequently in the same way.
* Get along with all kinds of people.
* Use hands and fingers skillfully and easily.
* Stand or walk for long periods of time.
* Lift and carry things like heavy trays and tables.
* Be available on nights, weekends, and holidays.

**Language Skills:** Must have developed language skills to the point to be able to: Read instructions, rules, etc.

**Data:** Comparing: Judging the readily observable functional, structural or compositional characteristics (whether similar to or divergent from obvious standards) of data, people or things.


**People:** Serving: Attending to the needs, requests or the expressed or implicit wishes of people. Immediate response is involved.

title: Dental Billing Specialist
description:
Our state-of-the art dental office located in Brooklyn, New York. In our practice we are committed to creating a positive environment for our patients and their families. Our primary goal is making every patient's experience positive and fun.

We are looking for a Dental Biller/Insurance Coordinator. We are seeking candidates that enjoy working with patients and who would want to join a strong team of professionals.

**Full job description**

Our Dental Billing and Collections professionals are responsible for billing and collecting payments from patients and insurance companies.

Dental Billers review insurance claims prior to submission to ensure accuracy.

Dental Billers adjust claims as appropriate, evaluate denials for accuracy and ensure they are addressed in a timely fashion.

Dental Billers follow up on submitted claims as necessary, ensure that secondary bills are submitted and received in a timely manner, identify and resolve overpayments made by patients and insurance carriers.

Collect and review information for prior authorizations.

Monitor and record late payments, and accounts receivable.

Follow-up on missed payments and resolve financial discrepancies

Examine patient bills for accuracy and request any missing information.

Investigate and appeal denied claims.

Dental Billers assist patients with collections and in setting up payment plans.

**Required Skills/ Experience:**

* Minimum of two years of dental office billing.
* Prior work experience with insurance plans and claims processing..
* Develop treatment plans.
* Prepare bills and invoices, and document amounts due to procedures and services.
* Can work independently with little supervision.
* Must be a team player.

**\\*\\*All employees of our practice are expected to safeguard patient privacy and confidentiality and to perform other duties as assigned**

Must live within commutable distance

**COVID-19 considerations**:  
Our office follows all CDC, ADA, AAPD, and OSHA guidelines to keep our team members and patients safe.

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

title: Immigrants' Rights Attorney
description:
**Position:**

TakeRoot Justice invites applications for an open position on our Immigrants’ Rights team, which currently includes three Staff Attorneys, two Senior Staff Attorneys and a Director. We will consider applicants with three (3) or more years of relevant immigration law experience, or those with five or more (5+) years of relevant immigration law experience, who would be eligible for a Senior Staff Attorney designation.

**Background:**

TakeRoot Justice provides legal, participatory research and policy support to strengthen the work of grassroots and community-based groups in New York City to dismantle racial, economic and social oppression. Applicants are encouraged to learn more about TakeRoot’s work by visiting our website: https://takerootjustice.org/ TakeRoot’s Immigrants’ Rights team works in conjunction with community-based organizations to build power in immigrant communities by protecting individuals from detention and deportation and keeping families together. We work alongside our partners to provide their staff and membership with direct representation on affirmative and defensive immigration cases. Additionally, we provide community education and strategy support on many issues including immigrant community defense networks, immigrant tenants’ and workers’ rights organizing and the push for more humane immigration policies.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Direct representation of clients on a range of affirmative and defensive immigration matters including applications for Asylum/CAT/Withholding, U/T visas, VAWA, SIJS, family-based petitions, cancellation of removal, waivers of inadmissibility, and post-order advocacy, including representing individuals in immigration and family court and, when needed, federal district court;
* Develop relationships and conduct community education presentations for partner organizations and their members, including on occasional evenings and weekends;
* Support partner organizing groups’ members and campaigns by providing advocacy, research, strategy and action support;
* Staff community-based legal clinics and advise clients of their avenues for relief;
* Advocate to legislative and regulatory bodies on behalf of immigrants and community-based organizations;
* Assist the practice area director and resource management team in grant compliance and fundraising;
* Provide peer and technical support to attorneys, advocacy coordinators and interns within TakeRoot as needed;
* Participate in TakeRoot’s self-governance structure, including collective staff decision-making, participation in governance circles or working groups;
* Together with TakeRoot staff, develop and maintain relationships with community-based partners throughout New York City.

**Ideal Candidates will:**

* Be committed to economic, racial, and immigrant justice movements in New York City;
* Be passionate about working toward immigrant justice within a community lawyering model, serving community-based organizations and their members, and developing creative lawyering strategies to support immigrant organizing;
* Enjoy, and have experience in working with a team in a collaborative model that uplifts all voices on the team and encourages professional development;
* Have a J.D. degree;
* Be admitted to the bar of any state in the U.S., with a preference for New York;
* Have at least three (3) years of experience representing immigration clients in affirmative and defensive proceedings;
* Have fluency in a second language (Bengali, French, Haitian Creole, Nepali, Spanish and/or Tagalog will be prioritized);
* Have strong writing, analytical, and interpersonal skills;
* Be self-directed and enthusiastic about boundary-pushing immigration advocacy.

**Salary and compensation:**

The expected salary range for this position is between $78,290 and $91,350. The salary is commensurate with experience and will be determined using the salary setting procedures set forth in the collective bargaining agreement. An excellent benefits package is available, including generous vacation, personal, and sick time, along with strong medical and dental coverage. This is a union position, proudly represented by Local 2320 of the National Organization of Legal Services Workers, UAW.

**Hybrid Workplace Statement:**

This is a full-time, hybrid position with some in-person work required in our New York City office location as well as sites such as courthouses and community-based organizations throughout the city. TakeRoot Justice is a hybrid remote workplace that allows employee flexibility in determining whether to work remotely or in the office, for routine, independent work that doesn't require office resources. Additional work hours rules are set by TakeRoot Justice's Collective Bargaining Agreement.

**Application Instructions:**

Interested applicants should send a cover letter, resume and writing sample by e-mail only (no hard copies please) in a single PDF labelled under their name with the subject line “IR Staff Attorney” to jobs@takerootjustice.org, Attn: Nadia Qurashi. Applications will be considered on a rolling basis until the position is filled. Please do not apply directly on the Indeed website.

TakeRoot Justice is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law.

We know from experience and research confirms that the more societal power people enjoy, the more likely they are to apply for a job without meeting all the listed criteria. This means that the people who have faced the most structural barriers but who may bring the most to a job may take themselves out of the running.

If you believe that you could excel in this role, we encourage you to apply. We are dedicated to considering a broad range of candidates, including those with diverse work experience and backgrounds. Please use your cover letter to tell us about your interest in the immigrants’ rights space and what you hope to bring to this role.

TakeRoot encourages applications from people with diverse backgrounds, including, but not limited to, women, people of color, immigrants, people with disabilities, LGBTGNCNBQI+ people, people from low-income backgrounds, people of all ages and people with personal experience with the criminal justice system. We strongly encourage applications from people who have had lived experience in the communities we serve. TakeRoot believes that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $78,290.00 - $91,350.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

License/Certification:

* J.D. Degree (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10038 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10038: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
**About Us:**  
20/20 Inspections & Engineering partners with top builders and engineers to bring some of NYC’s most iconic structures to life. Now, we’re taking a bold step forward by developing a groundbreaking proprietary software set to revolutionize the construction industry. With a clear vision to evolve this solution into a market-dominating SaaS product, we are focused on optimizing build times and delivering unparalleled service to industry leaders. This is your opportunity to be part of a fast-growing company driving change and innovation in the construction landscape.

**Position Overview:**   
As a Product Manager, you will play a critical role in advancing our proprietary software. By leveraging market insights and real user feedback, you’ll translate business needs into actionable product features and work closely with developers to ensure the product meets its objectives. You’ll be hands-on in all phases of product development and iteration, maintaining alignment with user needs and business goals. Our innovation-driven culture gives you the autonomy to experiment and push boundaries, delivering tangible results in a fast-paced environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Drive Product Execution:** Partner with the Product Manager to implement strategic roadmaps and ensure alignment across teams, driving the product vision from concept through release.
* **Data-Driven Insights:** Conduct in-depth analysis of industry trends, user behavior, and market data to shape product enhancements and innovation.
* **Collaborative Development:** Work closely with the development team to refine features, streamline workflows, and ensure seamless integration across the product ecosystem.
* **Lifecycle Management:** Actively engage in all phases of the product lifecycle, from ideation and prototyping to iteration and market delivery, ensuring each stage meets business and user needs.
* **Quality Assurance Leadership:** Lead efforts in testing and validation, ensuring that every feature meets both technical and performance standards, and aligns with industry best practices.
* **Strategic Contribution:** Participate in cross-functional product meetings, offering analytical insights and actionable feedback to influence product decisions and optimize outcomes.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 1-2 years of experience in product management, engineering, or desktop/systems support.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.
* Solid understanding of software development and product lifecycle management.
* Experience in the construction or engineering industries is a plus.
* Ability to be decisive in a fast-paced, agile environment.

**What Sets You Apart:**

* You thrive in an environment where innovation and flexibility are key.
* You have a knack for solving problems and enjoy collaborating across different departments.
* You’re not afraid to wear multiple hats and contribute to desktop/systems support or engineering efforts when needed.

**Why Join Us:**  
This is more than just a job—it’s an opportunity to be part of a company that’s reshaping the future of construction and engineering. As a member of our team, you’ll have the chance to grow with us as we continue to innovate and expand into new markets. If you’re looking for a role where your work will have a tangible impact on the industry, this is the place for you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $85,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

title: Compliance Officer
description:
.....
**Title:** MWBE Contract Compliance Consultant  

**Position Type:** Long-term, temporary
  

**Location:** New York, NY  

**Hours:** 35 per week  

**Salary: 55.00 to 68.00 per hour**  

  

**Job Description** Our client, an NYC education agency, is seeking a MWBE Contract Compliance Consultant downtown NYC office.  

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design and advise on the development of a comprehensive monitoring and enforcement strategy for MWBE compliance while integrating with existing DOE procurement compliance structures. Key components include tracking and reporting MWBE participation, developing training materials, and establishing a support framework for ongoing compliance monitoring encompassing the following:
* Create tracking and reporting mechanisms for MWBE participation as subcontractors
* Customize solutions to adapt to evolving standards
* R1763 MWBE Contract Compliance Consultant and MWBE Research Support Specialist
* Perform in-depth analysis of current structures, systems, forms, and tools and advisement on improvements, modifications, and/or adjustments
* Recommend utilization and/or integration with current agency Systems (eg FAMIS, COGNOS, CTS, PASSPORT) to effectively and efficiently monitor MWBE subcontracting compliance
* Develop a process and mechanism to confirm subcontractor payments. Specifically, prime contractors must submit forms and proofs, like Payment Voucher Forms and canceled checks, to verify MWBE subcontractor payments.
* Develop a process and mechanism to confirm ongoing prime and subcontracting agreements
* Develop a process and mechanism to confirm work being performed by a subcontractor. E.G. Conduct surveys and request documentation to ensure proper MWBE participation and performance
* Trigger points for routine compliance monitoring
* Create compliance monitoring training modules for MWBE program staff scoped and sequenced to build staff depth of understanding and capacity
* Build in checkpoints to evaluate process execution and functionality
* Design MWBE compliance monitoring reports
* Conduct MWBE compliance monitoring as specified by the MWBE Compliance Team
* Periodically review contracts to ensure adherence to MWBE policies and progress toward goals

**Requirements:**
* At least 8 years of experience in MWBE compliance monitoring and enforcement.
* Proven experience designing and implementing compliance strategies within large, complex organizations, preferably within government or education sectors.
* Proficiency in developing and integrating compliance monitoring tools and reporting mechanisms.
* Comprehensive understanding of NYC Administrative Code 6-129 and other relevant MWBE laws and regulations.
* Experience in establishing processes for verifying subcontractor payments, agreements, and performance.
* Ability to conduct detailed reviews and audits to ensure adherence to MWBE policies.
* Experience developing training modules and support frameworks for ongoing compliance monitoring.
* Advanced skills in data analysis and reporting using compliance monitoring tools.
* Expertise in customization and adaptation of compliance solutions to meet evolving standards.
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross-departmental initiatives and work collaboratively with various stakeholders.
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage complex projects from inception to completion.

For immediate consideration, please submit your resume today!

title: Program Manager (Health)
description:
### **Who We Are:**



At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.



Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.


**Where you shine**



VML Health is looking for an experienced Program Manager who can quickly understand our clients' needs and objectives with the ability to effectively manage a variety of internal stakeholder across multiple departments in their efforts to deliver on those objectives. The Program Manager is responsible for building, coaching, and leading teams to ensure successful delivery of projects by monitoring and managing against process across the brand portfolio. VML Health needs individuals who are proactive problem solvers that can manage team dynamics, manage project financial performance, clearly communicate status, and drive project deliverables to meet deadlines.


**What your success will look like**


* Lead multiple projects and/or programs of projects under one or more clients
* Manage projects as well as coach, manage and mentor direct reports
* Continuously monitor project health via resourcing, profitability and burn rates
* Identify project risk and create risk mitigation plans
* Works closely with Client Engagement and delivery teams to architect solutions that best meet client requirements
* Create/draft scopes of work and staffing plans
* Manages internal teams and client relationships in alignment with Client Engagement team
* Become an expert in our health clients' medical/legal/regulatory review processes
* Responsible for interviewing and making recommendations to hire at the Program Manager level and below
* Serve as a key point of contact and liaison for cross-divisional teams, agency peers and management
* Partner with Client Engagement to organically grow accounts
* Support creation of RFP responses with other teams within VML and new business engagement.


**What you'll need**


* 6+ years of project management experience including working at a marketing agency and experience working with pharmaceutical brands
* Extensive team management skills for teams of 8+
* Ability to provide proactive and assertive leadership in problem solving, managing financial success of projects, maintaining timelines, and reducing waste
* Strong interpersonal skills and able to resolve conflict with productive outcomes
* Ability to effectively work across departments with diplomacy and a firm understanding of other's roles and perspectives
* Ability to manage multiple work-streams (projects) effectively and efficiently.
* Ability to view problems in context at the system level and align solutions with the strategic direction of our clients and company
* Experience with multiple application lifecycle management solutions
* Proactive, adaptable, and flexible
* Life-long learner, demonstrated commitment to continuous improvement
* Strong attention to detail
* Demonstrable ability to operate under tight deadline with complex business/technical solutions
* Ability to manage workload with minimal supervision
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Bachelor's degree in business administration, marketing, or equivalent experience preferred
* PMP Certification preferred


At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.



When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

title: Full-Time Store Associate (New Store)
description:
As a Store Associate, you’ll be responsible for merchandising and stocking product, cashiering, and cleaning to keep the store looking its best. You’ll enhance the customer shopping experience by working collaboratively with the ALDI team and providing exceptional customer service.


**Position Type:** Full-Time
  

**Average Hours:** 32-40 hours per week  

**Starting Wage:** $20.00 per hour  

**Wage Increases:** Year 2 - $20.50 | Year 3 - 21.00 | Year 4 - $21.00 | Year 5 - $22.00



Duties and Responsibilities:
  

Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.

  

* Consistently demonstrate the Mindsets, ALDI Acts Competencies and Professional Skills (M.A.P.) as outlined for the role.
* Processes customer purchases, perform general cleaning duties, stocks shelves and merchandise displays neatly
* Provide exceptional customer service, assisting customers with their shopping experience
* Collaborate with team members and communicate clearly to the store management team
* Provide feedback to management on all products, inventory losses, scanning errors, and general issues
* Participate in taking store inventory counts according to guidelines and monitoring inventory for accuracy
* Adheres to cash policies and procedures to minimize losses
* Complies with all established company policies and procedures while upholding the security and confidentiality of documents and data
* Other duties as assigned


Physical Demands:


* Ability to stock merchandise from store receiving to shelving; ability to place product, weighing up to 45 pounds, on shelving at various heights
* Regularly required to sit, stand, bend, reach, push, pull, lift, carry and walk about the store
* Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation



Qualifications:


* You must be 18 years of age or older to be employed for this role at ALDI
* Ability to provide prompt and courteous customer service
* Ability to operate a cash register efficiently and accurately
* Ability to safely and properly operate equipment, including electric/manual hand jack, floor scrubber, and cardboard baler
* Ability to perform general cleaning duties to company standards
* Ability to interpret and apply company policies and procedures
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to work both independently and within a team environment
* Ability to stay organized, give attention to detail, follow instructions and multi-task in a professional and efficient manner
* Meet any state and local requirements for handling and selling alcoholic beverages



Education and Experience:


* High School Diploma or equivalent preferred
* Prior work experience in a retail environment preferred
* A combination of education and experience providing equivalent knowledge


ALDI offers **competitive wages and benefits,** including:

* 401(k) Plan
* Company 401(k) Matching Contributions
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* PerkSpot National Discount Program


In addition, **eligible employees** are offered:

* Medical, Prescription, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Generous Vacation Time & 7 Paid Holidays
* Up to 6 Weeks Paid Parental Leave at 100% of pay
* Up to 2 Weeks Paid Caregiver Leave at 100% of pay
* Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
* Life, Dependent Life and AD&D Insurance
* Voluntary Term Life Insurance

As a proud Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), we do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, religion, sex, sexual stereotyping, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), or any other protected characteristic. title: Associate Director of School and Teacher Programs
company: Museum of Jewish Heritage - A Living Memorial to the Holocaust
description:
The Museum of Jewish Heritage – A Living Memorial to the Holocaust educates about the broad tapestry of Jewish life before, during, and after the Holocaust. The Associate Director of School and Teacher Programs ensures students and teachers have the opportunity to learn from the Museum’s collections and exhibitions in line with school curriculum.


**Responsibilities**


* Planning and implementing professional development for teachers, including budget proposal and oversight, program evaluation and reporting, and writing applications for NYC DOE ASPDP and CTLE credit when appropriate.
* Supporting the planning and implementation of interfaith school programs, special school partnerships, and partnerships with American service academies.
* Writing curriculum for exhibitions, including tours, lessons, worksheets, teachers’ guides, writing and leading virtual and in-person stand-alone lessons, as well as updating and adding to online Holocaust Curriculum as needed.
* Representing the Museum at professional association conferences for teachers.
* Writing and editing final reports on programs and department website content.
* Overseeing event registration, outreach database updates, maintenance and reporting on data about school and teacher programs, and others.
* Supervise School and Teacher Programs Coordinator
* Other responsibilities including leading tours and lessons as needed, assisting with tour group entry, and other duties as assigned.


**Requirements**


* Full-time classroom teacher experience preferred.
* Experience managing projects and staff preferred.
* MA or MS in Education, History, Holocaust Studies, or Museum Education
* Strong knowledge of Jewish history
* Excellent writing skills, teaching, organizational, budgeting, and interpersonal skills
* If hired, we require all employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, unless a medical or religious accommodation is needed as determined on a case-by-case basis.


**Position Details**


* Reports to Senior Director of Education and Visitor Services
* Supervises School and Teacher Coordinator
* Salary Range $65,000-$75,000 with a generous benefits package
* Full-Time, 40 hours a week


The Museum of Jewish Heritage is an equal-opportunity employer. As a cultural institution that teaches about the dangers of intolerance, the Museum is dedicated to promoting diversity, multiculturalism and inclusion in its hiring practices.


For consideration, qualified candidates should submit their resumes and letter of interest to: humanresources@mjhnyc.org

title: Terminal Supervisor PABT
description:
**TERMINAL SUPERVISOR (PABT)**
Salary $85,986.70 **Forbes List of America's Best Employers 2022, 2023, & 2024**
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll join us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets customers to their destinations on time–and we're looking to hire talented folks with a commitment to excellence to make it all possible. **Summary:**
Supervises and controls Bus Operations activities in assigned service area at the Port Authority Bus Terminal (PABT) - Station Starters and/or Ticket Agents. Ensures traffic flow through the PABT is managed effectively and company funds are kept secure. Ensures holiday service and staffing is at appropriate levels and that special situations and emergencies are managed professionally.**Roles and Responsibilities:*** Supervises and controls Bus Operations activities in assigned service area at the Port Authority Bus Terminal (PABT) - Station Starters and/or Ticket Agents. Ensures traffic flow through the PABT is managed effectively and company funds are kept secure. Ensures holiday service and staffing is at appropriate levels and that special situations and emergencies are managed professionally.
* Ensures courteous and complete information is provided regarding all service at the PABT, and that support force issues are handled promptly and effectively.
* Supervises and assigns the duties of agreement employees. Ensures Station Starters and Ticket Agents receive appropriate training and counseling. Performs first step grievances as necessary.
* Prepares reports and analyzes data regarding assigned service. Analyzes on-time performance regarding assigned service area and makes recommendations for necessary service changes.
* Operates and monitors the Port Authority Bus Terminal (PABT) computerized bus management system and the park/ride revenue control system.

**Education, Experience, and Qualifications:*** High School Diploma or equivalent, and three (3) years of experience in the transportation system sector (\\*Sector includes Aviation, Motor Carrier/Trucking, Maritime, Mass Transit and Passenger Rail; Freight, Military mobile operations as well as Postal and Shipping. \\*)
* Good written communications skills and experience using Microsoft Word required.
* Must possess a valid New Jersey State driver’s license at the time of hire and maintain such license for the duration of employment. Within six months of hire must obtain a CDL B permit. Within twelve months of employment employee must obtain a CDL B with a Passenger Endorsement.

**Physical Demands:*** Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Some walking and standing relative to interaction with other personnel.
* Ability to lift 25 lbs.
* Travel to NJT facilities as needed

**At NJ Transit, you will enjoy a competitive salary and excellent benefits package:*** Comprehensive Family Health Insurance – Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life Insurance
* Paid Leave
* Tuition Assistance
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Plan
* Retirement Plans

 **At NJ TRANSIT, diversity and inclusivity are vital to our success as are committed to hiring individuals from diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and veteran status. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we encourage all qualified applicants to apply and join our team.** **The DOT Drug and Alcohol Testing Regulation 49 CFR Part 40 does not authorize the use of marijuana for any reason. It is unacceptable for any safety-sensitive employee subject to drug testing under DOT regulations to use recreational or medical marijuana. The prohibition includes any derivative of marijuana such as CBD oils, teas, etc. The use of recreational and medical marijuana is a violation of NJ TRANSIT’s Drug and Alcohol-Free Workplace Policy for safety-sensitive employees.**

title: Director, ERP Systems
description:
Move forward with us! At NJ TRANSIT, you'll be joining us in transforming the third-largest transportation agency in North America. We are committed to delivering safe, reliable service that gets our customers to their destinations on time—and we’re looking to hire talented folks with a love of learning to make it all possible.
**Summary:**  

Oversees technology policies, programs, and infrastructure. Directs all aspects of ERP operations, including establishing policies and procedures for protecting security and privacy. Leads a team of IT managers, creates department budgets, and takes ownership of all significant department decisions and initiatives. Selects IT providers, negotiates contracts, and guides the design and implementation of critical software systems and programs.  

  

**Roles and Responsibilities:**
* Drives the successful implementation, optimization, and ongoing management of Oracle ERP systems to support the organization's growth and operational excellence.
* Oversees all aspects of the Oracle Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system within NJ Transit.
* Develops and executes the strategic roadmap for Oracle ERP implementation and optimization that is aligned with the organization's objectives.
* Provides leadership to the ERP team, including hiring, training, mentoring, and performance management. Works closely with the project/program manager for ERP Cloud Implementation.
* Collaborates with other departments to ensure seamless integration of Oracle ERP with other systems and applications, such as HRIS, Grant Accounting, Project/Resource Planning, and Supply Chain Management.
* Ensures Oracle ERP systems comply with regulatory requirements, security standards, and industry best practices and align with the organization's network and security policies.
* Drives continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency, effectiveness, and usability of Oracle ERP systems and related processes.
* Manages relationships with Oracle and other third-party vendors, negotiate contracts, and oversee service-level agreements.
* Develops training programs and provide ongoing support to ensure users have the necessary skills and knowledge to maximize the benefits of Oracle ERP.
* Identifies and mitigates risks related to Oracle ERP implementation, data security, system performance, and business continuity.


**This Position Supervises:**
* Program Manager
* Technical Lead


**Education, Experience and Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Programming, Software Development, Data Analytics or related field and eight (8) years of ERP systems related experience
* Must have experience in Implementing Oracle Cloud ERP solution.
* Must have experience with Oracle ERP Cloud or E-Business Suite (EBS) versions.
* Must have experience with hiring, training, and developing ERP staff.
* Must have experience with change management methodologies to drive user adoption of Oracle ERP systems.
* Must have experience with managing relationships with Oracle and other ERP vendors.


**Knowledge and Skills:**
* In-depth knowledge of Oracle ERP modules, including Financials, Supply Chain Management, Human Capital Management, Procurement, and others.
* Proficiency in Oracle ERP implementation methodologies, such as Oracle Unified Method (OUM) or Oracle Application Implementation Methodology (AIM).
* Demonstrated understanding of Oracle ERP architecture, data models, and integration capabilities.
* Strong leadership skills to inspire and guide the ERP team toward achieving organizational goals.
* Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple projects and initiatives.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement and relationship management.
* Demonstrated problem solving skills and strategic thinking necessary to develop long-term plans for Oracle ERP implementation and optimization that are aligned with business objectives.
* Ability to analyze complex business processes and recommend ERP solutions to improve efficiency and drive growth.
* Demonstrated understanding industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements related to ERP systems.
* Ability to develop training programs and provide ongoing support to end-users.
* Proficiency in addressing resistance to change and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
* Knowledge of risk management principles to identify and mitigate Oracle ERP implementation and operation risks.
* Knowledge of data security, privacy regulations, and compliance requirements relevant to ERP systems.
* Ability to manger relationships with internal stakeholders, including executives, department heads, and end-users.
* Strong analytical skills to analyze complex issues, identify root causes, and propose practical solutions.
* Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Oracle ERP systems.
* Willingness to stay updated with the latest developments in Oracle ERP technologies and industry trends.
* Ability to adapt to changes in technology, business requirements, and organizational priorities.


**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:**
* Certifications in Oracle is a plus


**At NJ Transit you will enjoy a competitive salary and excellent benefit package:**
* Comprehensive Family Health Insurance – Medical, Prescription, Dental, Vision
* Flexible Spending Account
* Life Insurance
* Paid Leave
* Tuition Assistance
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Plan
* Retirement Plans
	+ 401(a) - Retirement plan with a 6% employer contribution

title: Engineering Director, Product Area
description:
Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. But we've got more left to do — and that's where you come in!



Duolingo is the world's most popular learning app. Beyond our core learning product, we also offer English proficiency testing with the Duolingo English Test, and are bringing new subjects into the Duolingo app, where people can develop their Math and Music skills.



We are passionate about educating our users, making fact-based decisions, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. We offer meaningful work, limitless learning opportunities, and collaboration with world-class minds. Come brighten your life and over half a billion more!



As an Engineering Director at Duolingo, you'll have the unique opportunity to shape the future of learning by leading cross-functional teams in developing innovative solutions. This role combines strategic leadership, business insight, and technical knowledge. Essential to the role is the ability to effectively handle complex leadership situations, ensuring alignment and delivering impact.


**Learning R&D Area:**


* The Learning R&D Area works on improving the learning experience of our users with new bets, technologies, and features, that fill the learning gaps in our product. Our goal is to make Duolingo the best way to level up your language skills, regardless of your proficiency level.


**Growth Area:**


* The Growth Area focuses on attracting new users, retaining current users, and bringing users back to Duolingo. More users = more data (so we can teach better) and more paid subscribers (so we can invest in making the app even better, and keep the lights on!). Our area's goal is to make Duolingo so fun and delightful that our learners stick around to make real progress and tell their friends all about it!


**You will...**


* Define the strategy and set the roadmap for your teams
* Be a strong cross-functional partner with product, design and data science (and other functions, depending on the product area) and invest in those relationships.
* Be an excellent manager of managers, training and coaching newer managers and engineering leads.
* Navigate complex leadership skills of being inclusive of different viewpoints; checking for alignment; and knowing when it's best to pushback vs. make a decision vs. "disagree and commit."
* Shape key decisions about architecture and implementation of scalable and high quality engineering solutions
* Drive the planning, execution, and success of elegant technical projects


**You have...**


* Strong technical chops. This is table-stakes. Our engineering leads are not only excellent people managers, team builders and strategic thinkers. They also have the deep technical background which allows them to "trust, but verify" that the right technical decisions are being made and that their area is executing strongly. They allocate time for learning in order to stay on top of technical advances.
* Strong business acumen. This means having a deep understanding of their part of the business; following industry trends; and being able to think several years ahead.
* Solid product sense. Engineering leads at Duolingo don't "stay in their lane." They use the product and features that they are building every day, are deeply familiar with how it works and have strong opinions of what's working well in the product, what could be improved, and what to build next. They also use products/apps from peer industries (gaming, for instance) to learn from best-in-class.

title: Behavior Technician
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Behavior Technician to join our team. As a Behavior Technician, you will provide direct support to individuals with developmental disabilities, implementing behavior plans and assisting with daily living activities. Your role will be crucial in helping individuals achieve their goals and improve their quality of life.

Duties:  
- Implement behavior plans developed by the Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)  
- Collect and record data on client progress and behavior  
- Assist with the development and implementation of individualized care plans  
- Provide direct support to individuals with developmental disabilities, including assistance with activities of daily living (ADLs)  
- Utilize applied behavior analysis (ABA) techniques to promote positive behavior change  
- Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to ensure coordinated care  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical documentation and records  
- Monitor and report any changes or concerns in client behavior or progress  
- Follow all safety protocols and maintain a safe environment for clients

Qualifications:  
- High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's degree in psychology, special education, or related field preferred  
- Previous experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred  
- Knowledge of applied behavior analysis (ABA) principles and techniques  
- Strong communication skills, both verbal and written  
- Ability to work independently as well as part of a team  
- Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills  
- Compassionate and patient demeanor

Benefits:  
- Competitive pay based on experience and qualifications  
- Opportunities for career advancement and professional development  
- Comprehensive training program provided  
- Supportive work environment with a collaborative team

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals with developmental disabilities, we encourage you to apply for the position of Behavior Technician. Join our team and help us create positive change!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

* Paid training

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)
* Working with adolescent children with disabilities: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Woodbridge, NJ (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Woodbridge, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Automation Associate, Overnight Shift
description:
**Our Mission**



At Prose, beauty is personal. We create truly custom haircare + skincare that's tailored to the individual because we know that Personalization Works BetterTM. We have the clinical results and over 500K+ 5-star product reviews on Review & Refine® to prove it. Every formula is personalized according to an in-depth consultation that takes into account over 80 factors — from diet to lifestyle, stress levels to ZIP code. This data is processed through a proprietary algorithm and made to order in the Prose lab using naturally powerful + proven-effective ingredients.



This is the opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and an energetic team that is transforming the way people think about and shop for personalized beauty. As a certified B Corporation, and the first and only carbon-neutral custom beauty brand, sustainability and social impact are at the heart of everything we do. We're doing away with one-size-fits-all beauty standards and creating more inclusive spaces for uplifting the beauty of the individual.


*This role is based on site at our Sunset Park, Brooklyn manufacturing facility and pays $24 p/h*


**Key Responsibilities**


* Retrieve batch record files for the days' production run from Order Management System (OMS)
* Maintain continuous flow of components to prevent line stoppage.
* Monitor inventory levels of base formulas and complexes throughout the production run.
* Properly scan all finished products into the OMS and store in trolley bins.
* Evaluate base and complex filler to confirm material is dispensing correctly.
* Troubleshoot all malfunctions on the automation line and communicate the findings immediately.
* Work cross functionally with Clean Technicians to establish a daily clean and sanitizing schedule of the Virtuo and Lino sections of the automation line.


**Key Candidate Requirements**


* Ability to multitask and prioritize work.
* Extreme attention to detail.
* Posses a "can do" attitude.
* Enthusiastic to succeed in a new role.
* Eager to learn and grasp new concepts.
* Maintain consistent workflow in a fast paced environment.
* Ability to maintain a clean work space.
* Possess the basic knowledge of the Order Management System (OMS) to process customer orders.
* Strong communication skills.
* Be able to lift over 50 pounds.
* Must have served 6 months or more in your current role.

  


**Always apply safe work habits.**

  

**Prose Values**


***Intentional Inclusivity***


* We know the best ideas come from open minds and willingness to listen. While our products cater to the individual, an invitation into our process is always open to our community.
* We value our differences and diverse backgrounds by communicating openly, managing with transparency and striving to understand one another's perspective. It's a key ingredient to our innovation.


***Connected Collaboration***


* Our strength as a group will outlast our efforts as individual contributors. With offices across countries, staying inventive and agile deepens our clear vision and consistent communication.
* We stay in a spirit of entrepreneurial collaboration: We do not have consensus at all times, but we trust one another to work toward our common goals. Our success is an expression and result of our progressive and gratifying teamwork.


***Driven, Together***


* We value ownership and coaching that encourages employees to think constructively and creatively about the business. We view employees as leaders and individuals who are accountable, resourceful and responsible. Anyone and everyone is encouraged to lead.
* We recognize that in order to continue thinking one step ahead, we will need to try new things. We strive to provide an open environment that accepts this truth, making space for new ideas to emerge.


***Humanity Always***


* We assume good intentions in every interaction, keeping ourselves accountable for the climate we create. We seek to understand our co-workers through this lens of conscious benevolence, authenticity and fellowship.
* We operate with the intention of preserving resources, creating an environment we can all live in – for our business and the world. Sustainable care is essential to our ethos as an organization. We take a mindful approach to how we think about our people (employees) and our planet.


**Perks & Benefits**



Prose fosters inclusivity, learning, and diversity within our teams and workplace. Just as we celebrate unique beauty, every team member is encouraged to show up as their full self. In addition to creating an environment where all individuals feel welcome, we offer benefits that include:


* A competitive and flexible PTO policy
* Competitive compensation package
* Company sponsored health care plan ( medical, dental and vision plans)
* 401k + matching
* $125 monthly wellness allowance
* FSA and commuter benefits

title: Global Commodity Specialist
description:

**This role is also responsible for reporting, analysis and planning of commercial commodities demand, commodities hedging gains & losses, and forecasting P&L impact for a group of Commodities that are part of the hedging portfolio. It is responsible to provide support to the team on daily, weekly and periodic activities like process payments, month end activities and reconciliations.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**What are we looking for?**
----------------------------

* **Bachelors in finance, Economics, or related.**
------------------------------------------------
* **Understanding of general accounting concepts; knowledge of debits/credits, assets/liabilities, Balance Sheet and P&L.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Advanced proficiency in data analytics tools (Alteryx, Power BI, Python, MS Power Platform, Excel) with implementation experience preferred.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Strong experience in financial reporting and treasury management systems (SAP, HFM, FIS Quantum)**
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Strong mathematical and analytical skills, including the ability to interpret financial data, handle large data sets, and standardize data and create workflows.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Proven effectiveness in project management, individual contributions, and team collaboration**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Experience working within a team environment, including with individuals in various geographic locations.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Agile, curious, and proactive thinker to explore, design, implement, and train others in innovative digital solutions.**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.**
-----------------------------------------------------

**What will be your key responsibilities?**

* **Serve as the Finance partner to the Commercial and Commercial Finance teams as well as treasury for all Commodity related cashflows required by the global commodity program to meet margin requirements or to facilitate derivative settlements.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Responsible for the daily operational controls of the Global Commodity program including but not limited to trade collection and reconciliation to brokers trade listings and clearing broker statements, calculating and reconciling open trade equity of the commodity positions, trade allocation to support direct accounting processes and other controls as required from time to time.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Responsible for calculating and raising Intercompany cross charges for all categories in the global commodity program as needed.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Responsible for supporting the team on daily operations.**
------------------------------------------------------------
* **Responsible for journal entry, reconciliation and maintaining GL accounts regarding hedging gains and losses, deferred gains and losses, and broker payable/receivable at period close along with the subsequent reporting and analysis related to all commodities hedging P&L.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Calculates and issues commodities cover and performance reports for stakeholders and senior business leaders across multiple functions and is able to analyze and share insights.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Where appropriate, addresses issues and recommends opportunities for improvement.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Provide support to the team and assist with the onboarding of new counterparties and Implementation of new programs as appropriate.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**What can you expect from Mars?**
==================================

* **Work with over 140,000 diverse and talented Associates, all guided by the Five Principles.**
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Middle School Group Leader
description:
**Job Description** 

**Job Title:** Group Leader

**Reports to:** Youth Program Manager

**FLSA Status:** Part Time, Non-Exempt

**PROGRAMS:** YOUTH

**General Job Description:** 

The Group Leader provides supervision and leadership for all SONYC participants. The Group Leader plans and facilitates daily club activities with the Program Director while helping to support the emotional, social, and physical development of children in grades 6-8. This position requires a creative, energetic, self-motivated team player with a passion for positively impacting our community. **It is strongly recommended that the group leader has an interest/passion in the following: Fitness, Basketball, and other recreational activities.**

**Major/Minor Duties and Responsibilities:** 

* Understand and implement program expectations, policies, and protocols to ensure a safe and respectful environment in alignment with agency, school, and funder protocols and guidelines.
* Create and implement effective and interesting age-appropriate lesson plans and curriculum that adhere to program goals.
* Collaborate with after-school staff around themes and special projects and take supervision and direction from the Program Director.
* Communicate with the Program Director about any schedule, and behavioral or environmental issues.
* Role model and communicate appropriately with all program stakeholders (participants, families, and staff).
* Assist participants in homework and provide them with tools to succeed in school.
* Assist with organizing and implementing special events, activities, and projects.
* Ensure the safety of all participants.
* Create a nurturing and fostering atmosphere to learn and create a sense of belonging for participants.
* Secure and clean spaces used at the end of the program.
* Attend scheduled staff meetings and complete professional development hours indicated when hiring.

**Requirements/Qualifications:** 

➢ Successful Background check and State Central Registry clearances are required.

➢ College degree or currently enrolled in college preferred.

➢ 2-3 years of experience working with children.

➢ Commitment to young people and an understanding of the factors affecting their lives

➢ An ability to establish good relationships with a range of people

➢ Must be friendly, patient, tolerant, and flexible.

➢ Physical abilities. (Standing, lifting, bending, climbing, walking, etc.)

**Work Schedule:** Monday – Friday **2:45 pm – 6:00 pm** 

**Rate Of Pay: $18/hr**
